1. "We the Living" (1967) - This is a drama film directed by Sidney Lumet about a group of people who are left to fend for themselves when their employer goes bankrupt. 2. "Eraserhead" (1977) - This is a drama film directed by David Fincher about a group of people who are left to fend for themselves when their employer goes bankrupt. The film stars Tom Cruise as David Mearns, one of the surviving workers, and J. Michael Seaton as Bob Zmuda, a businessman who invested in the company that went bankrupt.

Based on these two movies' themes and plotlines, they might appeal to someone who is interested in stories about people who are left to fend for themselves when their employer goes bankrupt.
